questions.question: The company has reported 'accelerating and/or plunging sales' deterioration year-over-year (-4% to -20% or possibly higher)
questions.factor: Deterioration of Financial Performance: Topline (Sales)

questions.question: The company has adopted an aggressive and/or persistent downsizing and cost-saving effort (i.e., sale of subsidiaries, closing stores, employee layoffs, protect-terminations)
questions.factor: Material Strategic Action: Divesture of Subsidiary, Disinvestment, downsizing and/or cost-saving (closing of stores and/or downsizing labor force)

questions.question: The company has a concerningly low current ratio and quick-ratio
questions.factor: Deterioration of Financial Performance: Severe Liquidity problems

questions.question: The company post profit losses in which year-over-year trends identify that the 'plunge is accelerating' (-4% to -20% or possibly higher)
questions.factor: Deterioration of Financial Performance: Bottom Line (Profits)

questions.question: The company has increasingly accumulated debt. This is reflected in a concerningly high and consistently growing debt-to-assets-ratio and/or debt-to-equity-ratio
questions.factor: Significant Debt Levels and/or Accelerated Accumulation of Debt

questions.question: The company features structurally constrained operations which make it unable to adjust to threatening forces (i.e., price compete) and/or take advantage of favourable opportunities (i.e., less ability to innovate, improve operations)
questions.factor: Structural Paralysis preventing strategic action or change in response to internal and external environment pressures

questions.question: The company has experienced a widespread loss in confidence and/or legitimacy by key investors, creditors and business partners
questions.factor: Loss of confidence and/or legitimacy by investors, partners, suppliers creditors and/or customers

questions.question: The company has adopted a radical restructure and/or turnaround strategy to address an underperforming business
questions.factor: Material Strategic Action: Restructure, Rebrand, Turnaround and/or Redirection

questions.question: The company's stock has 'collapsed or persistently drifted to deficient levels' threatening its compliance with the exchange listing standards
questions.factor: Steep Decline in Stock Price and/or Exchange Delisting

questions.question: The company has changed key leadership positions (i.e. CEO) as a result of poor performance
questions.factor: Change in Executive Leadership

questions.question: The company has hired legal and/or capital structure advisors to assist in navigating the troubled state of the organization
questions.factor: Employ Strategic Advisors: legal, capital structure and/or financial

questions.question: The company has frequently sought external financing or refinancing strategies to navigate coming due debt obligations
questions.factor: Obtaining External Financing and/or Refinancing Attempt

questions.question: The company has adopted a rapid expansion strategy, either domestically or internationally, that aims to significantly grow their footprint (i.e., widespread store expansion, aggressive acquisition strategy)
questions.factor: Material Strategic Action: Adopts Aggressive Expansion Strategy

questions.question: The company was recently acquired or spun off by a Private Equity firm or new Parent Organization
questions.factor: Material Strategic Action: Firm Sale or Divesture

questions.question: The company has consistently reported sales deterioration when compared across multiple years (-1% to -5%, or possibly higher)
questions.factor: Deterioration of Financial Performance: Topline (Sales)

questions.question: The company posts consistent profit losses when compared across multiple years (-1% to -5%, or possibly higher)
questions.factor: Deterioration of Financial Performance: Bottom Line (Profits)

questions.question: The company conducted a material turnaround or restructure attempt which ultimately made them financially worse and/or failed to address critical issues
questions.factor: Failed Strategic Restructure, Turnaround and/or Redirection

questions.question: Performance of core products and services have slowed and/or lost considerable market share
questions.factor: Declining/Lagging Product and/or Service Performance

questions.question: The company has recently completed a large-scale acquisition
questions.factor: Material Strategic Action: Acquires A Large Company

questions.question: The company faces threatening and market share eroding competition from multiple sources and types of competition (peer incumbents, disruptive new entrants, and/or big-box businesses)
questions.counterQuestion: How would you rate the firm's ability to effectively defend and succeed given these threatening types of competition?
questions.factor: Increasing and/or Aggressive Competitive Rivalry

questions.question: Management has made strategic choices and decisions that were outright wrong and/or materially unfavourable to the business (post execution result)
questions.counterQuestion: How would you rate management’s capabilities to rectify and address the poor strategic choices and decisions made in the past?
questions.factor: Management's Strategic Errors

questions.question: Management has shown naivety, complacency and/or routineness in responding to a threatening competitive landscape or evolving business environment (i.e., nonchalant action, slow action, same strategic approaches)
questions.counterQuestion: How would you rate management’s motivation to act with proactive engagement and/or use new strategies to effectively respond to a threatening competitive landscape or evolving business environment?
questions.factor: Complacency in Responding to Change in Environment

questions.question: Customers have shown a change in preference or demand for core products and services of the organization
questions.counterQuestion: How would you rate the firm's ability to successfully navigate this change in customers behaviour and realign with their preferences?
questions.factor: Changes in Consumer Tastes, Demand or Market Power

questions.question: Management has shown inferior capabilities to measure, understand and/or anticipate material business-related matters
questions.counterQuestion: How would you rate management’s capabilities to improve upon their strategic foresight flaws to rectify past events and prevent future events?
questions.factor: Management’s Inferior Strategic Foresight

questions.question: The company has adopted a rapid expansion strategy, either domestically or internationally, that aims to significantly grow its footprint (i.e., widespread store expansion, aggressive acquisition strategy)
questions.counterQuestion: How would you rate the firm's ability to manage this aggressive growth over the long-term?
questions.factor: Aggressive, Ambitious and/or Risky Growth Endeavors

questions.question: The company lacks quality resources and core competencies needed to achieve essential competitive advantages and support future growth
questions.counterQuestion: How would you rate the firm's ability to establish appropriate resources and capabilities to achieve essential competitive advantages and support future growth?
questions.factor: Lack/Loss/Misallocation of Quality Resources and Distinctive Competencies

questions.question: The company appears to underestimate the need for marketing and/or has an undifferentiated marketing strategy compared to their peers
questions.counterQuestion: How would you rate the firm's ability to implement a new and improved marketing strategy?
questions.factor: Inadequate Marketing, Marketing Mix and/or Branding

questions.question: The company appears overwhelmed by a high debt burden loaded on the company during a past Private Equity buyout
questions.counterQuestion: How would you rate the firm's ability to manage its debt obligations in relation to the Private Equity imposed contractual debt agreement?
questions.factor: Constrained by Leveraged Buyout Debt

questions.question: The company is financially vulnerable to a recessionary downturn
questions.counterQuestion: How would you rate the firm's ability to navigate a recessionary downturn successfully?
questions.factor: Recessionary Downturn

questions.question: The company's industry is facing wide-ranging disruption, turmoil and/or change (i.e., consolidation, a shift in investor confidence)
questions.counterQuestion: How would you rate the firm's ability to successfully navigate this?
questions.factor: Industry-Wide Disruption and Complexities

questions.question: There is material disharmony inside of the organization amongst employees and/or lower management
questions.counterQuestion: How would you rate the firm's ability to effectively address the disharmony and create optimized relationships with these internal stakeholders?
questions.factor: Internal Stakeholder Disharmony

questions.question: Top-level management appear over confident, arrogant, and/or ignorant as a result of the company's past success
questions.counterQuestion: How would you rate the firm's ability to sufficiently govern the privileges, perks and decision making capabilities of executives and ultimately manage any success-driven ego's and strategic blinders?
questions.factor: Hubristic Leadership Traits

questions.question: The company has experienced frequent turnover within the top-level executive team
questions.counterQuestion: How would you rate the firm’s potential to achieve success over the long-term under the new executive(s)?
questions.factor: Frequently Changing Management Team

questions.question: The company is mainly dependent on deteriorating low margin (low value) products or services
questions.counterQuestion: How would you rate the firm's ability to find enhanced value in their current array of products or services and/or diversify into new value-generating products or services?
questions.factor: Low Value/Devaluing Business Activities (Products/Service)

questions.question: Management appears resistant to evolve the business strategy or operations in light of material changes occurring in the industry landscape or evolving business environment
questions.counterQuestion: How would you rate management’s will and motivation to actually respond to a threatening competitive landscape or evolving business environment?
questions.factor: Management's Resistance to Change

questions.question: Top-level management have conflicting self-interests which could materially influence their strategic decisions and behaviours
questions.counterQuestion: How would you rate the firm's ability to govern and manage any top-level management conflicting self-interests?
questions.factor: Management's Conflicting Self-Interests

questions.question: The company's core assets or asset related obligations (resource commitments, rents, mortgage payments) are restricting their strategic action in response to internal and external environment changes
questions.counterQuestion: How would you rate the firm's ability to successfully manage these inadequacies stemming from the asset-related obligations?
questions.factor: Asset Entrenchment Vulnerabilities

questions.question: The company has taken on considerable debt to support growth endeavours
questions.counterQuestion: How would you rate the firm's ability to manage its debt obligations in relation to the level of risk associated with the growth endeavour?
questions.factor: Debt Funded Growth
